sen.j: 袙 （あこめ。「衵」と書くこともある）は、装束で使われる内着の一種。
sen.e: Akome
Akome
Akome is a kind of uchigi (daily wear or inner wear) worn under certain costumes.
sen.cmt: 一文が括弧内の句点で２つに分かれていましたので、一つにまとめました。

sen.j: 正式名称は袙衣（あこめぎぬ）と言い、肌着と表着の間に「相籠めて」着ることから、その名があるという。
sen.e: It is formally called "Akomeginu" as Akome is worn between undergarment and outer garment (stuffing up or covering something is pronounced "aikomete" in old Japanese.)
It is formally called "Akomeginu" as Akome is worn between undergarment and outer garment (stuffing up or covering something is pronounced "aikomete" in old Japanese.)

sen.j: 男性が束帯装束に着用するもので（明治以降は皇族のみ着用）ある。
sen.e: Akome was basically worn by men in 東帯 costume but only the Imperial family wore Akome after the Meiji period.
sen.cmt: 東帯の読み方不明。一原文一訳文の例外対処。
sen.e: Akome was basically worn by men in sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) costume but only the Imperial family wore Akome after the Meiji period.
Akome was basically worn by men in sokutai (traditional ceremonial court dress) costume but only the Imperial family wore Akome after the Meiji period.

sen.j: 例外的に宮中に仕える少女が成人用の袿の代用として複数枚用いた。
sen.e: As an exception, girls waiting in the Imperial court wore several Akome in place of Uchigi (ordinary kimono) for adults.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 特に、砧打ちや板引などの加工を施した袙を「打衣」（うちぎぬ）と呼ぶ。
sen.e: Akome which went through the process of kinutauchi (hammering the cloth) or itabiki (coating the cloth) is specifically called "uchiginu."
sen.cmt: 砧打ち・板引の訳に説明を加えました

sen.j: 身頃は着物の原則に従い二幅で、垂領（現在の着物と同じ前で打ち合わせるタイプ）。
sen.e: Migoro (Front and back of kimono excepting the "eri" [collar], "sode" [sleeves], and "okumi" [front]) is double width like other kimono, and tarikubi (wrapped front with V-shaped neckline) which is as same as today's kimono.

sen.j: 袖は広袖と言って袖口が広く、袍などと違って布一幅分（袍などは一幅半）である。

sen.e: It is tailored to awase (lined garment) using red-colored hiraginu (plain silk) or aya (twilled silk.)
